adrFormatAddress: 330 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018-1404, USA

editorialSummary.text: Informal hotel with free breakfast, plus a rooftop cocktail bar, a sports bar & a fitness center.

originalText.text:
The best thing about this place is absolutely the position!
The room was clean and when you check in they let you choose if you want it clean every day or every two days.
The breakfast is well-assorted! The breakfast room is a bit small compared to the huge number of guests in the building, so if you don't go around 7 am, you probably have to wait to be seated.
The elevator sometimes, especially in the morning, takes really a lot of time. Unfortunately one day we waited more than 15 minutes on our floor and decided to take the stairs to go down (22 floors), that is why I am giving to the hotel 4 stars.
The staff is really nice and welcoming, especially the ones in the breakfast room!

The elevator sometimes, especially in the morning, takes really a lot of time. Unfortunately one day we waited more than 15 minutes on our floor and decided to take the stairs to go down (22 floors), that is why I am giving to the hotel 4 stars.
The staff is really nice and welcoming, especially the ones in the breakfast room!

originalText.text:
The rooms are nice but a bit small. Understandable for New York City. Only two of the elevators were working while we were there. This was a problem. I waited for 12 minutes to go downstairs for breakfast and then decided to take the stairs. Breakfast was the standard hotel fare, but with more lines.
Overall, I’d be willing to stay here again but I’d try to stay somewhere else.

originalText.text: This hotel charges a lot per night and yet they have staff who don't speak a word of English.is this really a Marriott hotel? Breakfast is free, but nothing great, the usual continental breakfast. It takes ages to get into the elevator especially during breakfast time. Parking is not available. Very disappointed with our stay for the price. The rooms are tiny. The only positive thing is that it's close to times square. There are better ones at a cheaper rate. Do your research. Wouldn't recommend this place.

Very disappointed with our stay for the price. The rooms are tiny. The only positive thing is that it's close to times square. There are better ones at a cheaper rate. Do your research. Wouldn't recommend this place.

originalText.text: Great location, steps to subway, Port Authority & Times Square. Rooms were clean & cosy. Breakfast area was bright and the staff and food selection was incredible. They were also happy to let you take breakfast items to go. Have to give a mention to the front desk staff who were all so warm and friendly, went out of their way to make sure we were well taken care of. Anna Leigh in particular was excellent and professional. Alexis and Gregory also did a wonderful job. Would definitely recommend.

They were also happy to let you take breakfast items to go. Have to give a mention to the front desk staff who were all so warm and friendly, went out of their way to make sure we were well taken care of. Anna Leigh in particular was excellent and professional. Alexis and Gregory also did a wonderful job. Would definitely recommend.

originalText.text: Great hotel! All staff members are friendly. Room was clean. Location is central if you want to be near Times Square. Anna at the front desk was extremely accommodating and always professional. Personally I do not like staying near Times Square but would stay here again mainly because of the staff!
